item.title: Loyalty point
item.dc:creator: @boi_jx boi_jx
item.description:
@boi_jx wrote:

I tried to make a loyalty points timer and I added the files
player.java
loyaltypoints,

and added this to playersave.java
} else if (token.equals(“loyalty-points”)) {
p.loyaltypoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);
and this to playersave.java
characterfile.write("loyalty-points = ", 0, 12);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.loyaltypoints), 0, Integer.toString(p.loyaltypoints).length());
characterfile.newLine();

I tried to make it like this under client.java

public void mymessage() {
EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
public void execute(EventContainer c) {
c.loyaltypoints += 50;
sendMessage("<col=500500500><shad=0><img=2>[SERVER NOTICE]<img=2><col=0><shad=0>: Dont Forget to ::vote ");
}
}, 200000); //Time it takes to send the message
};

but when I compile it is says
error cannot find symbol c.loyaltypoints += 50;
^
symbol: variable loyaltypoints
location: variable c of type event container

item.title: Loyalty point
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

I would create a Task using a task system like this one. Then in the task execution logic you can do something like,

[code=java]for (Player player : PlayerHandler.getPlayers()) {
if (player == null) {
continue;
}

player.setLoyaltyPoints(player.getLoyaltyPoints() + 50);
}[/code]

Read full topic
